brief: A JSONObject is an unordered collection of name/value pairs

methods.name: getString()
methods.desc: Gets the String value associated with the specified key

methods.name: getInt()
methods.desc: Gets the int value associated with the specified key

methods.name: getFloat()
methods.desc: Gets the float value associated with a key

methods.name: getBoolean()
methods.desc: Gets the boolean value associated with the specified key

methods.name: getJSONArray()
methods.desc: Retrieves the JSONArray with the associated key

methods.name: getJSONObject()
methods.desc: Given a key value, retrieves the associated JSONObject

methods.name: isNull()
methods.desc: Determines if the value associated with the key is null, that is has no defined value (false) or if it has a value (true)

methods.name: setString()
methods.desc: Inserts a new key/String pair into the JSONObject

methods.name: setInt()
methods.desc: Inserts a new key/int pair into the JSONObject

methods.name: setFloat()
methods.desc: Put a key/float pair in the JSONObject

methods.name: setBoolean()
methods.desc: Put a key/boolean pair in the JSONObject

methods.name: setJSONObject()
methods.desc: Sets the value of the JSONObject with the associated key

methods.name: setJSONArray()
methods.desc: Sets the value of the JSONArray with the associated key

description:
A JSONObject stores JSON data with multiple name/value pairs. Values can be numeric, Strings, booleans, other JSONObjects or JSONArrays, or null. JSONObject and JSONArray objects are quite similar and share most of the same methods; the primary difference is that the latter stores an array of JSON objects, while the former represents a single JSON object.

JSON can be generated from scratch, dynamically, or using data from an existing file. JSON can also be output and saved to disk, as in the example above.
name: JSONObject
